sen.j: 藤原 俊家（ふじわら の としいえ、寛仁3年（1019年） - 永保2年12月2日 (旧暦)（1082年12月29日））は平安時代中期の公卿、歌人。
sen.e: Born in 1019 and gone on December 29, 1082, "FUJIWARA no Toshiie" was a top Court official & a maker of Japanese poetry in the middle of the Heian period.
Born in 1019 and died on December 29, 1082, "FUJIWARA no Toshiie" was a top Court official & a maker of Japanese poetry in the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: Grammar
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Toshiie (1019 - December 29, 1082) was a top court official and a waka poet in the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。表記訂正しました。&をandに訂正しました。court 小文字にしました。waka poet に訂正しました。

sen.j: 右大臣藤原頼宗の子。
sen.e: He was the son of "FUJIWARA no Yorimune" who became "Udaijin" (Minister of the Right).
He was the son of "FUJIWARA no Yorimune" who became "Udaijin" (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was the son of FUJIWARA no Yorimune who became Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。

sen.j: 正二位・右大臣。
sen.e: Toshiie himself reached "Shonii" (Senior Second Court Rank) & the title of Udaijin.
sen.cmt: ※俊家が号に「右大臣」と入れていることから、その由来を示すべくローマ字読みを併記しています。
sen.e: Toshiie himself reached "Shonii" (Senior Second Court Rank) & the title of Udaijin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Toshiie himself reached Shonii (Senior Second Rank) and the title of Udaijin.
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。Court 削除しました。&をandに訂正しました。

sen.j: 大宮右大臣と号す。
sen.e: So he called himself "Omiya Udaijin."
So he called himself "Omiya Udaijin."
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: So he called himself Omiya Udaijin.
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。

sen.j: 中御門流の祖であり、子孫からは中御門家（松木家）・持明院家を始めとして、9家の堂上家（羽林家）を出した。
sen.e: He was the ancestor of the Nakamikado lineage of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and his descendants gave birth to nine "Tosho-ke" (the hereditary families of high-ranking Court nobles), including the Nakamikado family (also called the Matsunoki family) & the Jimyoin family.
sen.cmt: ※「中御門流」は「藤原北家」の一つであり、その点、補って訳しています。
sen.e: He was the ancestor of the Nakamikado lineage of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and his descendants gave birth to nine "Tosho-ke" (the hereditary families of high-ranking Court nobles), including the Nakamikado family (also called the Matsunoki family) & the Jimyoin family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was the ancestor of the Nakamikado line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and his descendants gave birth to nine Tosho-ke (the hereditary families of high-ranking court nobles), including the Nakamikado family (also called the Matsunoki family) and the Jimyoin family.
sen.cmt: line に訂正しました。" "削除しました。court 小文字にしました。&をandに訂正しました。

sen.j: 長元4年（1031年）10月17日 従五位上、12月26日 侍従
sen.e: On November 10, 1031, he was given "Jugoinojo" (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), and on February 16, 1032, he was appointed to "Jiju" (Chamberlain).
On November 10, 1031, he was given "Jugoinojo" (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), and on February 16, 1032, he was appointed to "Jiju" (Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: November 10, 1031: He was given Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), and February 16, 1032: He was appointed to Jiju (Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 長元5年（1032年） 1月6日 正五位下
sen.e: On February 25, 1032, he was given "Shogoinoge" (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
On February 25, 1032, he was given "Shogoinoge" (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: February 25, 1032: He was given Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 長元6年（1033年） 1月5日 従四位下
sen.e: On February 13, 1033, he was given "Jushiinoge" (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
On February 13, 1033, he was given "Jushiinoge" (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: February 13, 1033: He was given Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 長元7年（1034年） 2月8日 右近衛中将
sen.e: On March 7, 1034, he was appointed to "Ukone no chujo" (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
On March 7, 1034, he was appointed to "Ukone no chujo" (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: March 7, 1034: He was appointed to Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 長元7年（1034年） 母の従弟の藤原経輔を随身に叩かせた罪で官職を解任。
sen.e: In 1034, he was deprived of his rank & position for having his guard hit "FUJIWARA no Tsunesuke," his mother's cousin.
In 1034, he was deprived of his rank & position for having his guard hit "FUJIWARA no Tsunesuke," his mother's cousin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1034, he was deprived of his rank and position for having his guard hit FUJIWARA no Tsunesuke, his mother's cousin.
sen.cmt: &をandに訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 長元8年（1035年） 1月12日 備後権守、10月17日 蔵人
sen.e: On February 28, 1035, he was appointed anew to "Bingo no gon no kami" (the provisional governor of Bingo Province), and on November 25, the same year, he was appointed to "Kurodo" (Chamberlain).
On February 28, 1035, he was appointed anew to "Bingo no gon no kami" (the provisional governor of Bingo Province), and on November 25, the same year, he was appointed to "Kurodo" (Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: February 28, 1035: He was appointed anew to Bingo no gon no kami (the provisional governor of Bingo Province), and November 25 of the same year: He was appointed to Kurodo (Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 長元9年（1036年） 4月17日 蔵人頭、7月10日 従四位上、11月7日 正四位下
sen.e: On May 21, 1036, he was appointed to "Kurodo no to" (Head Chamberlain), and on August 10, the same year, he was given "Jushiinojo" (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), and on December 3, the same year, he was given "Shoshiinoge" (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

On May 21, 1036, he was appointed to "Kurodo no to" (Head Chamberlain), and on August 10, the same year, he was given "Jushiinojo" (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), and on December 3, the same year, he was given "Shoshiinoge" (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: May 21, 1036: He was appointed to Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and August 10 of the same year: He was given Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), and December 3 of the same year: He was given Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 長暦2年（1038年） 6月27日 参議、12月21日 従三位
sen.e: On August 6, 1038, he was appointed to "Sangi" (Royal Advisor), and on January 24, 1039, he was given "Jusanmi" (Junior Third Rank).
On August 6, 1038, he was appointed to "Sangi" (Royal Advisor), and on January 24, 1039, he was given "Jusanmi" (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: August 6, 1038: He was appointed to Sangi (Royal Advisor), and January 24, 1039: He was given Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 長暦3年（1039年） 1月25日 正三位
sen.e: On February 26, 1039, he was given "Shosanmi" (Senior Third Rank).
On February 26, 1039, he was given "Shosanmi" (Senior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: February 26, 1039: He was given Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 長久2年（1041年） 8月27日 従二位
sen.e: On October 1, 1041, he was given "Junii" (Junior Second Rank).
On October 1, 1041, he was given "Junii" (Junior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: October 1, 1041: He was given Junii (Junior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 永承3年（1048年）12月7日 権中納言
sen.e: On January 19, 1049, he was appointed to "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Middle Counselor).
On January 19, 1049, he was appointed to "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Middle Counselor).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: January 19, 1049: He was appointed to Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。(a provisional vice-councilor of state)説明を訂正しました。

sen.j: 永承4年（1049年） 2月5日 正二位
sen.e: On March 17, 1049, he was given "Shonii" (Senior Second Rank).
On March 17, 1049, he was given "Shonii" (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: March 17, 1049: He was given Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 康平3年 （1060年）12月16日 右衛門督
sen.e: On January 16, 1016, he was appointed to "Uemon no kami" (Captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards).
On January 16, 1016, he was appointed to "Uemon no kami" (Captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: January 16, 1016: He was appointed to Uemon no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 治暦元年（1065年） 6月3日 権大納言、10月28日 民部卿
sen.e: On July 14, 1065, he was appointed to "Gon Dainagon" (Provisional Major Counselor), and on December 4, the same year, he was appointed to "Minbukyo" (Minister of Popular Affairs).
On July 14, 1065, he was appointed to "Gon Dainagon" (Provisional Major Counselor), and on December 4, the same year, he was appointed to "Minbukyo" (Minister of Popular Affairs).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: July 14, 1065: He was appointed to Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state), and December 4 of the same year: He was appointed to Minbukyo (Minister of Popular Affairs).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。(a provisional councilor of state)説明を訂正しました。councilor of state→chief councilor of state

sen.j: 承保3年 （1076年） 1月22日 按察使
sen.e: On March 6, 1076, he was appointed to "Azechi" (the inspector of the provincial government).
On March 6, 1076, he was appointed to "Azechi" (the inspector of the provincial government).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: March 6, 1076: He was appointed to Azechi (the inspector of the provincial government).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 承暦4年 （1080年） 8月14日 右大臣
sen.e: On September 6, 1080, he was appointed to "Udaijin" (Minister of the Right).
On September 6, 1080, he was appointed to "Udaijin" (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: September 6, 1080: He was appointed to Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: 表記訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 声がよくとおり、歌を詠いあげるのがうまかったといわれ、その声に誘われて多政方という舞の名人と阿吽の呼吸で舞い踊ったことが古今著聞集（橘成季の作）に記録されている。
sen.e: It is said Toshiie's voice carried so well that he could chant the Japanese poetry skillfully, and "Kokon Chomonju" (A Collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present) written by "TACHIBANA no Narisue" says that his chants sometime tempted a master of Japanese dancing named "O no Masakata" to dance in perfect tune.

It is said Toshiie's voice carried so well that he could chant Japanese poetry skillfully, and "Kokon Chomonju" (A Collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present) written by "TACHIBANA no Narisue" says that his chants sometime tempted a master of Japanese dancing named "O no Masakata" to dance in perfect harmony.
sen.cmt: Grammar
sen.e: It is said Toshiie's voice carried so well that he could chant Japanese poetry skillfully, and Kokon Chomonju (A Collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present) written by TACHIBANA no Narisue says that his chants sometime tempted a master of Japanese dancing named O no Masakata to dance in perfect harmony.
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。

sen.j: 能楽の「佐保山」にも俊家が登場するが、その内容を以下に紹介する。
sen.e: Toshiie's name also appears in "Saoyama," which is a program of the art of Noh, and the content is introduced below :
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 *以下、能楽・佐保山の中身については、[http://blog.funabenkei.daa.jp/?eid=615887] を参照しました。
sen.e: Toshiie's name also appears in "Saoyama," which is a program of the art of Noh, and the content is introduced below :
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Toshiie's name also appears in 'Saoyama,' which is a program of the art of Noh, and the content is introduced below:
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。スペース削除しました。

sen.j: 俊家一行が春日大社に参詣した際、佐保山の上に白雲のような物を見つける。
sen.e: When Toshiie and his entourage visited Kasuga-taisha Shrine, they found something like a white cloud on Mt. Saho;
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。*「佐保山」は、能楽の題名としては「さおやま」と読み、地名としては「さほやま」と読むようです。
sen.e: When Toshiie and his entourage visited Kasuga-taisha Shrine, they found something like a white cloud on Mt. Saho;
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: When Toshiie and his entourage visited Kasuga-taisha Shrine, they found something like a white cloud on Mt. Sao.
sen.cmt: 能の曲の中の地名なのでタイトルと同じく、Mt. Saoに訂正しました。スペース削除しました。

sen.j: その白い物は衣で、その衣をさらしていた女性らにその謂われを尋ねた。
sen.e: the white stuff turned out to be clothes, and Toshiie asked to women airing the clothes if these had some story;
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: the white stuff turned out to be clothes, and Toshiie asked to women airing the clothes if these had some story;
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The white stuff turned out to be clothes, and Toshiie asked to women airing the clothes if these had some story.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。文頭を大文字にしました。文末をピリオドにしました。

sen.j: すると、和歌にも詠まれている特別な衣だと答えた。
sen.e: then the women answered that the clothes were the special ones picked up in a certain Japanese poem as its topic;
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: then the women answered that the clothes were the special ones picked up in a certain Japanese poem as its topic;
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Then the women answered that the clothes were the special ones picked up in a certain Japanese poem as its topic.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。文頭を大文字にしました。文末をピリオドにしました。

sen.j: 女性らは、奈良の山々や景色、その山神の神徳と君が代の万歳をことほぎ、神祭りを見せよう、と言い、姿を消す。
sen.e: For celebrating Nara mountains, their beautiful scenery, the blessings of the deity of Kasuga-taisha Shrine and the prosperity of the Imperial Family, they would show the deity's dance, they said, and then they disappeared;
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 *「奈良の山々や景色、その山神の神徳と君が代の万歳をことほぎ」については、「奈良の山々とその素晴らしい景色、更には春日明神の恵みと天皇家の繁栄を祝して」と訳しています。
sen.e: For celebrating Nara mountains, their beautiful scenery, the blessings of the deity of Kasuga-taisha Shrine and the prosperity of the Imperial Family, they would show the deity's dance, they said, and then they disappeared;
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: For celebrating Nara mountains, their beautiful scenery, the blessings of the deity of Kasuga-taisha Shrine and the prosperity of the Imperial family, they would show the deity's dance, they said, and then they disappeared.
sen.cmt: family小文字にしました。スペース削除しました。

sen.j: そして佐保山の姫が現われ神楽を奏した、とのことである。
sen.e: afterward, the goddess of "Saoyama" appeared in the dream of Toshiie & others, and played "Kagura" (a musical dance).
afterward, the goddess of "Saoyama" appeared in the dream of Toshiie & others, and played "Kagura" (a musical dance).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Afterward, the goddess of Saoyama (Mt.Sao) appeared in the dream of Toshiie and others, and played Kagura (a musical dance).
sen.cmt: (Mt. Sao)補足しました。" "削除しました。&をandに訂正しました。文頭を大文字にしました。文末をピリオドにしました。
